Portfolio - Highlights

I have been working on various university and industry projects during the time of my studies. I can do ICT research, UX/UI design and develop web applications with React/Native and Tailwind

Utimaco website redesign

This was my first group university/industry project. We had the the task to redesign Utimaco's website with a "marketing approach" The Lo-Fi sketching was done in XD and Hi-Fi prototypes were done in Sketch and Invision. The website was programmed with Bootstrap, Vanilla JS, CSS and HTML.You can check the website here.

Facimate App

This is my second university group project. The app allows you to find people for professional causes or you can match them by hobbies. I call it a LinkedIn and Tinder hybrid. The prototypes were done in Figma and the research for our concept app was conducted by me and my team following the ICT research methods. The actual PoF is based on React and Firebase and few animation and design libraries. You can check the whole project here.

Hyster-Yale Group tyre monitoring cross-platform app

This is the biggest project for me, it took me almost a year to develop it and it is still being developed by ICT interns from Fontys. I created the project from the beginning and conducted the whole research - technical, usability and design. It was designed in Adobe XD from scratch and it had more than 5 revisions by me. Each component in the design is custom and built by me since the company is strict about licensing. I was responsible for the further development of the app with React Native, InfluxDB hosted on AWS and I used Victory Native visualization library. The app serves for optimizing the pumping process and monitoring of the port of Malta. It aims to improve the efficiency and sustainability of port operations. Tyres there are used on a huge scale, so an improvement of 5-10% per year in efficiency means a lot of resources, as well as less environmental impact.
